doc.title: RTSP: Real-time streaming protocol

value.content: Real-time streaming protocol (RTSP) is a network protocol that controls how the streaming of a media should occur between a server and a client. Basically, RTSP is the protocol that describes what happens when you click "Pause"/"Play" when streaming a video. If your computer were a remote control and the streaming server a television, RTSP would describe how the instruction of the remote control affects the TV.

value.title: See also
value.content:
• RTSP on Wikipedia
  • RFC 7826 (one of the documents that specifies precisely how the protocol works)
  • Glossary
    • RTSP
